intro: Crepis mollis subsp. mollis, commonly known as the slender sowthistle, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender, hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a single head, which are borne on slender peduncles. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. The species is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to colonize open habitats.
